data.title: Ontario Christian High School
data.meta_description: As a top-ranked private high school, Ontario Christian offers a college-prep curriculum to equip students to excel in scholarship and grow in discipleship.
data.text:
A private Christian High School equipping students to excel in scholarship and grow in discipleship.

Known as a top-ranked Inland Empire private school, Ontario Christian High School offers a Christ-centered, college preparatory curriculum to equip students to excel in scholarship and grow in discipleship.

Here, a diverse student body finds an encouraging, supportive, and positive environment in the classroom and beyond. When you walk onto campus, you’re “Knighted” as part of a family with a rich history of “Growing Christian Leaders.”



98%

Average percentage of graduates are seeking higher education



A-G

Our courses meet A-G requirements for four-year colleges and universities.



Students have access to 15 AP, advanced and honors classes.



27 CIF athletics teams.



Number of league championships.



Guidance

Individual college counseling and career guidance to meet the needs of all students.

j

Achievement

SAT/ACT scores are consistently above the California and National averages.



Creativity

A thriving fine-arts program provides creative opportunities for growth.

Biblically-Based Curriculum

Students learn to discover and appreciate God-inspired wisdom and beauty in all subject areas. With a firm Biblical foundation, students build vibrant and intimate relationships with the Triune God. Our goal is to prepare students to be distinctive types of leaders wherever God calls them.

Each subject is taught with the assumption that God is in control of every square inch of creation. So, whether it’s English, History, Science, Physical Education, or Math – students are learning about the subject matter and their God.

Academic Excellence

At Ontario Christian, we are committed to academic excellence and college preparation. We are accredited by the Western Association of Schools and Colleges (WASC) and Christian Schools International (CSI). All college preparatory, AP and Honors courses have been approved by the University of California and California State University systems as meeting the A-G course pattern. Each class curriculum goes through a rigorous approval process that includes teachers and administrators.

I'm Interested in the

College Bound

A 98% average percentage of Ontario Christian graduates are seeking higher education, and over $4 million on average in scholarships, grants, and financial aid are offered to each class over four years for academic and athletic excellence. Historically, more than 95% of our graduates go on to attend a 4-year college.

Knight Life

At Ontario Christian High School, we emphasize the development of students both academically and socially. Students have a wide array of extracurricular activities to choose from.

Athletics

With an average of 60% student participation, Ontario Christian High School School has 27 teams competing in CIF with multiple League and CIF championships and a legacy of student-athletes who have gone on to compete in college athletics.

Facts about Ontario Christian Athletics

60% average high school athletic participation.

Class of 2020 graduated 18 collegiate athletes

18 CIF Championships

2 State Championships

148 League Championships

Ontario Christian has won the Ambassador Cup seven out of the last 10 years and three years straight. The Ambassador Cup is a perpetual trophy awarded annually to the school with the best overall performance in a given academic year.

Fine Arts

Students learn to appreciate and celebrate the arts in various bands, choirs, classes, clubs, showcases, and performances. An immersive art studio provides the creative space for our Drawing and Painting, Ceramics, and Design classes, while Albers Chapel sets the scene for our bands, choirs, and school plays.

A Well-Rounded Experience

Leadership Opportunities

We provide many options for students to grow as Christian leaders through ASB, National Honor Society, California Student Federation, Peer Counseling, and more!

Clubs and Activities

Whether it’s resting your case with the award-winning Mock Trial team, visiting renowned museums and galleries with the Art Club, or exploring marine life on a dive with the Scuba Club, there are many ways to get involved, develop lasting friendships, and enhance learning off-campus.

Vocational Arts

Exploring interests such as Culinary Arts, Set Design and Building in the shop, designing a logo in the computer lab, or using one of our 3D printers for an engineering project, a broad array of courses offer an exceptional opportunity for students to collaborate and create.

27 Athletics Teams

Spiritual Life

Students are part of a loving community where they study the Word of God together and pray for one another in the morning devotional.

A Weekly Faith Experience

Each week, students worship God together in engaging chapel services. Additionally, each week students will meet with a small group of students led by a trusted adult staff member.

Bible Classes

Our students learn to align their will to God’s as they delve into the Word of the living God.

Old Testament

New Testament

Christian Perspectives

Apologetics and World Religions

Chapel Leadership

Christian Leadership

Service Learning

Students put their faith in action as they engage in community service and short-term mission trips. Our current high school students have dedicated over 6,322 hours to service (and counting). They have partnered with World Vision, Operation Christmas Child, the Dream Center, local food banks, and have traveled to Nicaragua to work with Students International.

Counseling and Career Center

Ontario Christian Counseling Center partners with students and parents to enhance student learning in academic development, college planning, career aspirations, and personal/social growth.

The primary goal of the School Counseling Program is to promote and enhance student learning through three broad and interrelated areas of student development: academic development, career development, personal/social development. Ontario Christian High School adheres to the National Standards for School Counseling Programs but adds a fourth dimension of spiritual development. We communicate with parents and students through the Campus Connection, our website, and email.

Please visit our College and Career Center Site for upcoming events, resources, and other information to assist you in your academic career.

Quick Facts about Ontario Christian High School

High School Grades 9–12: 390 Students

High School Campus Size: 31 Acres

Classrooms: 27

Full-time Teachers: 25

Part-time Teachers: 5

Student/Teacher Ratio: 13:1

Average Class Size: 22-24 student per classroom (Honors, AP, and Elective classes typically have fewer students per classroom)

Uniforms: Required through Dennis Uniforms

School Hours:

7:55am–2:50pm (M, Tu, Th, Fr)

8:55am-2:50pm (Late Start Wednesdays)

Campus Location

Ontario Christian High School

931 W. Philadelphia St. Ontario, CA 91762
